H0.text: On which of the hills of ancient Rome were the main residences of the Caesars. Quirinal

H1.text: On which of the hills of ancient Rome were the main residences of the Caesars. Aventine

H2.text: On which of the hills of ancient Rome were the main residences of the Caesars. Caelian

H3.text: On which of the hills of ancient Rome were the main residences of the Caesars. PALATINE

A4.text: Imperial palaces were built there, starting with Augustus.

A5.text: From the start of the Empire (27 BC) Augustus built his palace there and the hill gradually became the exclusive domain of emperors
